nodes.title: What We Do
nodes.html: DSNP.org is an independent non-profit organization, focused on stewardship of the Decentralized Social Network Protocol (DSNP). The organization fits within the umbrella of Project Liberty as the provider of one core component (the social graph protocol) that connects the many different technologies that make up a decentralized social network. Both DSNP.org and Project Liberty have been launched out of Unfinished Labs as part of their efforts to build public infrastructure for the web that puts citizens at the center of an innovative, inclusive web economy.

nodes.title: Our Partners
Forums
nodes.html: All questions and suggestions are welcome! If you’re curious about something or just wondering where the most appropriate place to start is, please post and we’ll do our best to help.

nodes.title: DSNP
nodes.html: Here you can find detailed documentation regarding the current state of the Decentralized Social Network Protocol, previous iterations and proposals for future extensions.

nodes.title: Testnet
nodes.html: The DSNP is backed by a blockchain network that helps applications find messages.  This is our testnet version of that blockchain.

nodes.title: SDK
nodes.html: The Software Development Kit offers the core features, communication facilitations, build configurations, and common components for DSNP-enabled applications.

nodes.title: Example Client
nodes.html: Using the DSNP SDK, the Example Client demonstrates how to quickly integrate with the DSNP and manage all three elements.
